alert.note: Alert for Chase (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 30 at 7:55PM CDT until May 31 at 4:00AM CDT by NWS Wichita
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT CDT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Flooding of streets, county roads, and small streams caused by excessive rainfall. * WHERE...Chase county. * WHEN...Until midnight CDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is occurring. Low-water crossings may not be passable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 751 PM CDT, Flooding is occurring in the warned area, including Strong City and Cottonwood Falls. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional thunderstorms are expected later this evening and tonight. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Cottonwood Falls, Strong City, Bazaar, Elmdale, Matfield Green, Cedar Point, Tallgrass Prairie, Tallgrass Prairie Preserve, Hymer, Saffordville and Wonsevu.
info.instruction: Do not drive into flooded areas or go around barricades. Nearly two feet of water will carry most vehicles away. Turn around, don`t drown. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
